page.title: 07CUSTOMS cont.
page.content: On 23rd October the people of Kineton would not be surprised to meet the ghost of Prince Rupert on his white horse. The nearest Sunday to the anniversary of the{Battle of Edge Hill is today marked by a parade of the regiments of the Sealed Knot Society at the monument alongside the road to Edge Hill. Present day members of the armed forces lead Kineton's{Remembrance}of the fallen in wars around the Village War Memorial in November. Poppy Wreaths are laid by representatives of various organisations and this ceremony is followed by a united Service in St Peter's Church. Just prior to Christmas Kinetonians gather in the Market Square to sing {carols}led by a choir standing on a farm cart. Roast Chestnuts, mince pies, soup and coffee are sold.
